isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3600, 3800, 4000FBC - CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse D1 and circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (2), move key switch to ignition position, and at (2) circuit 39A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39/39A, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2), and disconnect white wire at air dryer, move key switch to ignition position and at air dryer black wire connection, measure voltage to ground.
Air dryer black wire to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
At air dryer, measure voltage from black wire to disconnected white wire.
Air dryer black wire to white.
Locate open or poor connection in white ground wire, then repair.
At air dryer, measure voltage from ground stud to disconnected white wire, with unit cooled to below 50°F.
Air dryer gnd. stud to white wire.
If unit is below 50°F, repair or replace heated air dryer.
Optionally, at air dryer, measure voltage from ground stud to disconnected white wire, with unit warmed to over 80°F.
Air dryer gnd. stud to white wire.
Heated air dryer and circuits check good.
If unit is above 80°F, repair or replace heated air dryer.
Will engine crank over when the transmission is in neutral and the key switch (63) is moved to the start position?
Check fuse H1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
At H1, measure voltage from circuit 13F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13F, then repair.
With key off, disconnect engine harness dash conn. (2A) from cab dash conn. (2). Turn key on and at conn. (2), measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, then repair.
Install jumper wire to circuit 97P between conn. (2) and (2A). At (2A), with transmission in neutral and key switch on, measure voltage from circuit 97AU to ground.
Disconnect neutral position switch (438) and measure voltage from circuit 97P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97P, then repair.
With transmission in neutral position, measure resistance of neutral position switch (438).
Locate cause of low or no voltage in cir. 97AU, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (2A) and remove crank inhibit relay (661). Turn key on and at (661) circuit 97L, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 97AU, conn. (386), or circuit 97L, then repair.
Refer to Starting Motor System for further troubleshooting.
Check fuse G1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then correct. Replace fuse.
Remove modulator solenoid relay from socket (403). Turn key switch on and measure voltage from circuit 92E and then 92B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92E/92D or 92B/92D, circuit 92D, relay conn. (402) or dash conn. (2), then repair.
At socket (403), measure voltage from circuit 92B to 92C.
Bench test modulator sol. relay by verifying that contacts at pin 30 and 87 are closed when de-energized and open when relay is energized. Does relay test good?
With key off, disconnect ECM conn. (379) and install a jumper from circuit 92F to ground. At (403) measure resistance from circuit 92F to ground.
Remove jumper and refer to Engine Diagnostic Manual.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92F, conn. (402), or circuit 92F, then repair. Remove jumper and reconnect connectors.
Re-install modulator solenoid relay (403), and disconnect modulator shift solenoid conn. (404). Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 92C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 92C or conn. (389), then repair.
At (404), measure voltage from circuit 92C to 92-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 92-G, conn. (389), or circuit 92-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect modulator sol. at (404) and listen for it to shift. Did it click? Reconnect ECM connector (379).
Allison automatic trans. circuits check good.

note.para: For troubleshooting brake switch circuit input signals to the engine ECM, refer to the Engine Diagnostic Manual.

entry.para: Remove hydraulic brake relay (300) and measure voltage from circuit 90A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90-FL/90/90A, then repair.
Disconnect circuit 90N from reserve pump motor. Install a jumper wire at relay socket (300) from circuit 90A to 90N. At reserve pump motor circuit 90N, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90N, then repair.
Touch circuit 90N to reserve pump motor terminal. Does motor run?
Remove jumper, reconnect 90N. Go to next step.
Remove fuse E3 and check for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse E3 circuit 90B, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90B or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Re-install fuse E3. Disconnect brake switch conn. (50). At (50) measure voltage from circuit 90C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90C, then repair.
Measure resistance across switch (50) while brake pedal is depressed.
Reconnect conn. (50) and disconnect diode assembly (48) from conn. (47). At (47) and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from circuit 90D to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90D, then repair.
Disconnect brake monitor module conn. (49), and with brake pedal depressed, measure voltage from 90E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90E, then repair.
Check fuse A1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position and at A1, measure voltage from circuit 13 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 13, then repair.
At disconnected conn. (47), measure voltage from circuit 90U to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90U or 13B, then repair.
With multimeter in diode test mode, test diode assembly (48). Do diodes test good?
Reconnect diode assembly (47)/(48) and disconnect brake relay (300). Turn key on and at socket (300), circuit 90H, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90H or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Disconnect flow switch conn. (763) and measure resistance across switch.
At (763), measure resistance of circuit 90-G to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/ 11-GJ, then repair.
Reconnect flow switch conn. and disconnect differential pressure switch conn. (301). At (301) circuit 90L, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90L/90R, then repair.
At relay socket (300) circuit 90J, measure resistance to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in cir. 90J/90K, then repair.
Bench test hydraulic brake relay (300) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Bench test hydraulic brake relay (300) by applying +12V to pin 85 and ground to pin 86, and measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87.
At brake monitor module conn. (49), measure resistance from circuit 90M to ground.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90M or dash conn. (2), then repair.
Re-install brake relay (300). Turn key switch on and depress brake pedal. At conn. (49) circuit 90F, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90F, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed at conn. (49), measure voltage from circuit 90F to 90-G.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 90-G/11-G, then repair.
At conn. (49) and circuit 90R, measure voltage to ground while an assistant depresses brake pedal.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90R/70C, then repair.
With brake pedal depressed and at conn. (49), measure voltage from circuit 90P to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 90P, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (49) and move key switch to ignition position. Do alarm and brake warning light operate?
Hydraulic brake system circuits check good.
Check bulb, buzzer, and parallel circuits 90S and 90T, then replace or repair problem.
If condition persists, refer to CTS-5280 Hydro-Max II Brake Monitor System.
Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
Move key switch to ignition position, and at fuse D1, circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect inline conn. (N/L), move key switch to ignition position, and measure voltage at circuit 93 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39 or 93, then repair.
Reconnect inline conn. (N/L), and disconnect drain valve conn. (N/L). Move key switch to ignition position, and at black wire (coming from circuit 93), measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
At disconnected drain valve conn. measure voltage from black feed wire to black air dryer wire with air dryer cooled to below 50°F.
Black feed wire to cool air dryer wire.

svcsubproc.title: Heated Fuel Filter, Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

table.title: Heated Fuel Filter, Water-In-Fuel Light, Fuel Filter Restriction Light

entry.para: Does the fuel filter restriction light work properly?
Does the water-in-fuel system operate properly?
Does the heated fuel filter work properly?
Remove fuel heater relay (431). At relay socket, measure voltage from cavity C, circuit 19E to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19E, conn. (399), circuit 19D, or open fuse D2, then repair.
At relay socket, measure voltage from cavity A circuit 19F to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19F/19J, conn. (399) circuit 19J/28, or open fuse A2, then repair.
At relay socket (431), measure voltage from cavity B circuit 19-G to cavity A circuit 19F.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19-G, then repair.
Bench test fuel filter relay (431) by measuring resistance from pin 30 to 87A.
Apply +12V to relay pin 86 and ground to pin 85. Measure resistance from pin 30 to 87.
Reconnect relay (431) and disconnect circuit 19A from fuel filter. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19A or conn. (401), (2), or (399), then repair.
With the fuel heater cooled to below 50°F, measure voltage from circuit 19A to the heater power stud.
Fuel filter, 19A to heater power stud.
Heated fuel filter system checks good.
Repair or replace heated fuel filter.
Disconnect water-in-fuel module (470). Turn key on and at connector, measure voltage from circuit 19H to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19H/19J, conn. (399), cir. 19J/28 or for open fuse A2, then repair.
At WIF socket (470), measure voltage across circuit 19H to 19P.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19P, blocking diode (1CR), circuit 19N, conn. (399), cir. 19N, or key switch, then repair.
At WIF socket (470), install jumper from circuit 19H to 19L. Does warning light operate?
Disconnect WIF warning light conn. (433) and at cir. 19L, measure voltage to ground
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19L, then repair.
At WIF light connector (433), measure voltage across circuit 19L to 19-GA.
Locate open or poor connection in circuit 19-GA, then repair.
At WIF module connector (470) move jumper across circuit 19H to 19C. At the fuel filter, disconnect circuit 19C from the water probe. Turn key on and measure voltage from circuit 19C to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage condition in circuit 19C, conn. (399), dash conn. (2), or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Remove jumper and reconnect WIF module (470). At water probe conn., jumper circuit 19C to ground. Does light work?
Water probe conn., jumper 19C to gnd.
Remove water probe and install jumper from the probe to ground. Measure voltage from circuit 19C to water probe feed stud.
Water probe, 19C to probe feed stud.
Install probe and conn. WIF system checks good.
Remove filter light conn. (434) and measure voltage from circuit 19K to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19K/19J, conn. (399), cir. 19J/28, or open fuse A2, then repair.
Reconnect light conn. (434) and disconnect fuel filter switch conn. (N/L). Measure voltage from circuit 19B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 19B, conn. (399), dash conn. (2) or fuel filter conn. (401), then repair.
Fuel filter restriction light circuitry checks good. If condition persists, replace fuel filter switch.

svcsubproc.title: Two Speed Axle - With Manual Transmission and Electrically Controlled Axle Air Shift

table.title: Two Speed Axle - With Manual Transmission and Electrically Controlled Axle Air Shift

entry.para: Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D1, circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (800) and turn key on. At black wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39/93, conn. (N/L), or black wire, then repair.
Disconnect two speed switch conn. (87) and reconnect conn. (800). At (87) and green wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in green wire, then repair.
Test two speed shift switch (87) by placing it in low range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to brown wire.
Switch (87), green wire term. to brown wire term.
Test two speed shift switch (87) by placing it in high range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to blue wire.
Sw. (87), green wire term. to blue wire term.
Disconnect conn. (705) and reconnect switch (87). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position. At (705), measure voltage from brown wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Move two speed switch to high range position, and measure voltage to ground at (705) blue wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (244) and reconnect conn. (705). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position, and measure voltage to ground at (244) white wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in white wire, then repair.
Disconnect ECM conn. (379) and reconnect conn. (244). With two speed switch in low range position, turn key on, and measure voltage to ground at (379) circuit 93A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 93A, connectors (462) or (2), then repair.
Disconnect conn. (801) and reconnect conn. (379). Turn key on and move two speed switch to high range position, and measure voltage to ground at (801) tan wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in tan wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (802) and reconnect conn. (801). Turn key on, and with two speed switch in high range position, measure voltage to ground at (802) brown wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
While reconnecting conn. (802), listen for click of air solenoid. Does solenoid energize?
Electrically controlled air shift circuitry checks good.

svcsubproc.title: Two Speed Axle - With Manual Transmission and Electric Axle Shift Motor

table.title: Two Speed Axle - With Manual Transmission and Electric Axle Shift Motor

entry.para: Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D1, circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (800) and turn key on. At green wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39/93, conn. (N/L), or green wire, then repair.
Disconnect two speed switch conn. (87) and reconnect conn. (800). At (87) and green wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in green wire, then repair.
Test two speed shift switch (87) by placing it in low range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to brown wire.
Sw. (87), green wire term. to brown wire term.
Test two speed shift switch (87) by placing it in high range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to blue wire.
Sw. (87), green wire term. to blue wire term.
Disconnect conn. (705) and reconnect switch (87). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position. At (705), measure voltage from brown wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Move two speed switch to high range position, and measure voltage to ground at (705) blue wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (244) and reconnect conn. (705). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position. At (244), measure voltage from blue wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Disconnect ECM conn. (379) and reconnect conn. (244). With two speed switch in low range position, turn key on and measure voltage to ground at (379) circuit 93A.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 93A, connectors (462) or (2), then repair.
Disconnect conn. (709) and reconnect conn. (379). Turn key on, and with two speed switch in low range position, measure voltage to ground at (709) brown wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Move two speed switch to high range position, and measure voltage to ground at (709) tan wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in tan wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (703) and reconnect conn. (709). Turn key on, and with two speed switch in high range position, measure voltage to ground at (703) red wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in red wire, then repair.
Move two speed switch to low range position, and measure voltage to ground at (703) brown wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (703). Electric shift circuits check good. If shift motor fails to operate, repair or replace.

svcsubproc.title: Two Speed Axle - With Automatic Transmission (Non-Electronic) and Electrically Controlled Axle Air Shift

table.title: Two Speed Axle - With Automatic Transmission (Non-Electronic) and Electrically Controlled Axle Air Shift

entry.para: Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D1, circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (N/L) and turn key on. At circuit 93, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39/93, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (88) and reconnect conn. (N/L). At (88) and green wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in green wire, then repair.
Test two speed shift switch (88) by placing it in low range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to brown wire.
Sw. (88), green wire term. to brown wire term.
Test two speed shift switch (88) by placing it in high range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to blue wire.
Sw. (88), green wire term. to blue wire term.
Disconnect ECM conn. (379) and reconnect conn. (88). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position. At (379) circuit 93A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, tan wire, conn. (462), circuit 93A, conn. (462), circuit 93A, dash conn. (2), or circuit 93A, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (246) and reconnect conn. (379). Turn key on and move two speed switch to high range position. At (246) measure voltage from blue wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (801) and reconnect conn. (246). With switch still set, at (801) white wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in white wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (802) and reconnect conn. (801). With switch still set, measure voltage to ground at (802) brown wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
While reconnecting conn. (802), listen for click of air solenoid. Does solenoid energize?
Electrically controlled air shift circuitry checks good.

svcsubproc.title: Two Speed Axle - With Automatic Transmission (Non-Electronic) and Electric Axle Shift Motor

table.title: Two Speed Axle - With Automatic Transmission (Non-Electronic) and Electric Axle Shift Motor

entry.para: Check fuse D1 for open condition.
Locate cause of overload condition, then repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse D1, circuit 12, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 12, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (N/L) and turn key on. At circuit 93, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit 39/93, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (88) and reconnect conn. (N/L). At (88) and green wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in green wire, then repair.
Test two speed shift switch (88) by placing it in low range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to brown wire.
Sw. (88), green wire term. to brown wire term.
Test two speed shift switch (88) by placing it in high range position and measuring resistance from terminal going to green wire to terminal going to blue wire.
Sw. (88), green wire term. to blue wire term.
Disconnect (245) and reconnect switch (88). Turn key on and move two speed switch to low range position. At (245) measure voltage from brown wire to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Reconnect (245) and disconnect ECM conn. (379). At conn. (379) circuit 93A, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in tan wire, conn. (462), circuit 93A, conn. (462), circuit 93A, dash conn. (2), or circuit 93A, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (706) and reconnect conn., (379). With switch still set, measure voltage to ground at (706) black wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in black wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (703) and reconnect conn. (706). With switch still set, at (703) brown wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in brown wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (246), move two speed switch to high range, and at (246) blue wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in blue wire, then repair.
Disconnect conn. (706) and reconnect conn. (246). With switch still set, measure voltage to ground at (706) white wire.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in white wire, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (706), and with switch still set, at (703) red wire, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in red wire, then repair.
Reconnect conn. (703). Electric shift circuits check good. If shift motor fails to operate, repair or replace.
